subject: Re: Ghost Box Success Rate
author: Adriana Jones
full_text:
Yes, you're right, what are the chances... bazillion to one is right...

Scientists have a bias against religion because they equate it with blind faith and superstition, some of them perhaps even have a vendetta against their family religion, for making them grow up with a belief system that they feel is constrictive, and as scientist adults their emotional reaction is to do whatever is in their power to bash down anything that might point to a higher power or anything that transcends the five senses... as if a higher power and religion are synonymous (which they most certainly are not, if you ask me)... the truth is hardly ever black or white... the scientific bias and the religious bias.... neither one alone will ever arrive at the truth... the truth is somewhere in the middle...

I can also understand your sentiment in which you want to say "screw science", as you did below :), and it is that same frustration/resentment that some scientists have toward religion when they say "screw religion" and reject EVP recordings.  However, if you reject the scientific method, then you reject the other half of the truth, just like those scientists are doing.  The truth must meet in the middle.  
I too feel frustrated at how scientists manipulate the scientific method to arrive at the most "convenient" scientific results - often outright lies, probably, to be quite blunt.  Science is rife with corruption, as is just about every area of human endeavor where someone has something to personally gain. However, the concept of empirical science itself, when not tainted by the human elements, works to ultimately prove or disprove the given tested theories, in a more or less logical and objective manner. The scientific method does have its inherent limitations, but still  I feel that the evp area of research could have a lot to gain if some "community standards" could be adopted, in order to advance this area of research on common grounds, with a common language, where results could be compared, and apples could be compared to apples. Although none of us personally need this  to prove anything to ourselves - because we already know the communication is real and this conviction and certainty is what drives you  on further - to develop and adopt some sort of common scientific language, with which to discuss results, I think would help to lend a lot more credence to all of this.
 I say this because it looks like such a shame to me that all of the incredible work of you, Steve and all these other people I'm reading about and talking to online, is so easily ignored, when with the right approach and presentation, it seems to me that these results would be so convincing, that they would not only draw the incredible attention they deserve, but would also be nearly impossible to debunk.  The question of whether or not intelligent communication is occuring through these devices ought to be impossible to debunk, this is my gut feeling from my limited experience with it.  
I don't know maybe this is just the naive talk of a novice enthusiast, but this is how I feel.
